sling.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to throw or put something somewhere with a careless movement and some force
sling.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Lou slung his suitcase onto the bed.
Pete slung his bag over his shoulder.
sling.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to make someone leave or go to a place
sling.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Sam was slung into jail for punching a cop.
sling.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Dave wore a tool belt slung around his waist.
sling.translation[0].definitions[2].note: Sling is usually passive in this meaning
sling.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a piece of cloth tied around your neck to support an injured arm or hand
sling.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She had her arm in a sling.
sling.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a set of ropes or strong pieces of cloth that are used to lift and carry heavy objects
sling.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a special type of bag that fastens over your shoulders, in which you can carry a baby close to your body
sling.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a piece of rope with a piece of leather in the middle, used in past times as a weapon for throwing stones
